wms_article.title: HD Hyundai Heavy wins global certification for offshore substation design

wms_article_body.body: HD Hyundai Heavy Industries Co. has obtained international certification for its independently developed offshore substation, paving the way for its full-scale entry into overseas markets. The company announced on Wednesday that it received a design verification certificate from Norwegian classification society DNV for its self-developed 500-megawatt (MW) offshore substation, adding that it plans to strengthen its push into the offshore wind power market. Offshore substations are key facilities that transmit electricity generated by offshore wind farms to land. The DNV certification confirms the stability and technical validity of the substationâ€™s design through a review of technical documents. HD Hyundai Heavy Industries explained that the new 500 MW offshore substation model localized key equipment, establishing a stable supply chain and maximizing synergies with domestic component manufacturers. The certified 500 MW model is a standardized design suitable for large-scale offshore wind projects and can transmit power from 35 wind turbines with a capacity of 14 MW each.
